column4: Greetings all... having some problems getting DNS to work on new install of 8.4 server... tried the forums, anyone care to lend a hand?
Anyone able to help with a DNS issue?
sheesh... I'm talking to a bot...
You didn't ask a question.  All you said is "It doesn't work, can I ask?"
You'd want to explain in what manner it fails to work.
oh, sorry... can anyone help me figure out why DNS isn't resolving?
I can access by IP, no resolution on names
What is the nature of your internet supplier?
cable modem, comcast, but I tried to switch to opendns and it still isn't resolving
after you get your internet running, check if /etc/resolv.conf looks good
net is running fine, can ping by ip
nameserver in /etc/resolv.conf was set to the router, so I tried changing that to the first ip of opendns... that didn't work either
Normally the router supplied by comcast would perform dhcp server.
it is... for windows... for ubuntu I am getting no joy... dhcp is giving me a good ip, just no DNS
Ok, so you know your router (192.168.1.1) is functional as a nameserver, so the problem is your ubuntu isn't using it properly.
ayup... taht is about the size of it
if it can't get fixed here, maybe #networking will aid you.
